intro: Cassebeeria heterostemon, commonly known as the black root or black balsam, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic roots that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple. Its unique morphology and medicinal properties make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
